title: Cutaneous presentation preceding acute monocytic leukemia: A CARE-compliant article.
label: Figure 1
caption: Clinical features: multiple reddish, substantial papules, and plaques 0.5 to 2.0 cm in diameter involving the trunk and extremities.

title: Cutaneous presentation preceding acute monocytic leukemia: A CARE-compliant article.
label: Figure 2
caption: (A) Magnification of hematoxylin-eosin staining (HE) ×100. (B) Magnification of HE ×400. (C–E) The marker CD4, CD56 were positive, and CD123 was negative.

title: Clinical and pathological features of myeloid leukemia cutis.
label: Figure 1
caption:
A - Scattered dark red papules without coalescence on chest and
abdomen; B - Ulcerated and crusted tumor on left thigh; C - Multiple
nodules on limb; D - Scattered bright red papules with ulcers and
crusts on left upper extremity

title: Clinical and pathological features of myeloid leukemia cutis.
label: Figure 2
caption:
A - Diffuse dermal atypical myeloid infiltrates involving subcutis
with Grenz zone. (Hematoxylin & eosin, x10); B - Infiltrates
were composed of small to medium sized mononuclear cells with
atypical cytological features, including nuclear hyperchromasia,
coarse chromatin pattern, and thickened nuclear membrane.
(Hematoxylin & eosin, X40)

title: Clinical and pathological features of myeloid leukemia cutis.
label: Figure 3
caption:
A - Myeloid infiltrates were reactive for MPO (A), CD15 (B), CD43
(C), and negative for CD20 (D). (Hematoxylin and eosin, X10; CD15,
X10; CD43, X10; CD20, X10)

title: Cutaneous Leukemic Infiltrates Successfully Treated With Biomodulatory Therapy in a Rare Case of Therapy-Related High Risk MDS/AML.
label: Figure 1
caption: Cutaneous leukemic skin infiltrates: Skin lesions on the face (A,C,E) and the back of the left upper arm (B,D,F) are shown. Panels (A,B) represent the treatment-naive state. Panels (C,D) show the lesions after one cycle of azacitidine and one cycle of combined biomodulatory therapy. Panels (E,F) demonstrate complete remission of skin lesions after six cycles of biomodulatory treatment.

title: Cutaneous Leukemic Infiltrates Successfully Treated With Biomodulatory Therapy in a Rare Case of Therapy-Related High Risk MDS/AML.
label: Figure 2
caption: Blood counts: Blood counts of leukocytes (WBC), neutrophils and platelets are shown. Left y-axis shows values for WBC und neutrophils, right y-axis for platelets. The shown time period comprises the first cycle azacitidine as well as the first cycle of biomodulatory therapy (day 0 = begin of biomodulatory therapy).

title: Diagnosis and prognostic analysis of skin infiltration in chronic lymphocytic leukemia: a case report and literature review.
label: Figure 1
caption: Skin infiltration in the nasal. This image is published with the patient’s consent.

title: Diagnosis and prognostic analysis of skin infiltration in chronic lymphocytic leukemia: a case report and literature review.
label: Figure 2
caption: Biopsy results. The subcutaneous nodule of the finger showed atypical lymphoid cells infiltrate adipose tissue (hematoxylin and eosin) (A). Immunohistochemistry revealed CD20+ (B), BCL2+ (C) and CD5+ (D) cells (A-D magnification, ×200).

title: Skin mesenchymal niches maintain and protect AML-initiating stem cells.
